rounds.name: Nutrition
rounds.description: Test your knowledge about healthy eating and nutritional facts

questions.question: What is a balanced diet?
options: Eating a variety of foods from all food groups
Drinking only water and protein shakes
questions.correctAnswer: Eating a variety of foods from all food groups
questions.explanation: A balanced diet includes foods from all major food groups: proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, and minerals.

questions.question: Which nutrient is essential for muscle growth?
questions.explanation: Proteins provide the building blocks for muscle repair and growth.

rounds.name: Superfoods
rounds.description: Explore nutrient-dense foods and their benefits

questions.question: Which of these is often considered a superfood?
questions.explanation: Kale is rich in vitamins A, C, and K, and is considered a nutrient-dense superfood.

questions.question: Why are berries considered healthy?
options: They contain high amounts of sugar
questions.explanation: Berries are loaded with antioxidants which help protect your cells from damage.

rounds.name: Hydration
rounds.description: Check your knowledge about water intake and hydration

questions.question: How much water should an average adult drink per day?
questions.explanation: The general recommendation is around 2 liters (or 8 cups) of water daily for adequate hydration.

questions.question: Which of the following is a sign of dehydration?
questions.explanation: Common signs of dehydration include dry mouth, dizziness, and dark urine.

rounds.name: Exercise
rounds.description: Learn about different types of exercise and their benefits

questions.question: Which of the following is considered aerobic exercise?
questions.explanation: Aerobic exercises improve cardiovascular health, and swimming is one of the best examples.

questions.question: How often should adults exercise per week, according to health experts?
questions.explanation: Experts recommend at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity per week.

rounds.name: Healthy Habits
rounds.description: Discover the daily habits that contribute to overall health and wellbeing

questions.question: Which habit is NOT healthy?
questions.explanation: Even occasional smoking is harmful to health and increases risk of disease.

questions.question: What can help reduce stress levels?
questions.explanation: Exercise releases endorphins, which naturally reduce stress.
